title: Can Trump Handle a Foreign Crisis?
summary: He'll face one eventually, and there's good reason to worry the administration will be unprepared.. Someday this White House will face a sudden, immediate and severe foreign-policy crisis. It's almost a miracle it hasn't happened already. George W. Bush had 9/11 less than eight months into his tenure; John F. Kennedy had the Bay of Pigs three months into his presidency and the Cuban missile crisis the following year. In two years Donald Trump has faced some turbulence, but not a full-fledged crisis.

title: 'Good to Go' Review: The Best Way to Get Better
summary: For athletes, recovery methods exist on an "evidence continuum." Rest is a proven remedy for injury. Other strategies aren't so effective.. On the day Christie Aschwanden's book "Good to Go" arrived for my review, I crashed my bicycle. With the customary road rash, bruised muscles and damaged ego, I slogged my way home wondering what I should do to recover. Should I ride some more to get the circulation going, or rest my achy body? Should I apply ice or heat? Is there something special I should eat or drink? Everyone I asked had a different opinion.

title: New York's Famous Smoked Salmon Maker Wants a Big Brooklyn Expansion
summary: Acme Smoked Fish teams up with real-estate developer on multistory project. New Yorkers have long cultivated a taste for smoked fish, as in the nova salmon that accompanies a bagel and cream cheese. Now, the city's most prominent company devoted to such fare hopes to bank on that appetite in a commercial development it is proposing for Brooklyn's Greenpoint neighborhood.

title: The Socialist That Could
summary: Meet Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, the secret Republican weapon for 2020.. The Republican Party has a secret weapon for 2020. It's especially effective because it's stealthy: The Democrats seem oblivious to its power. And the GOP needn't lift a finger for it to work. All Republicans have to do is sit back and watch 29-year-old Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez . . . exist.

title: Abortion's Dred Scott Moment
summary: Overreach in New York and Virginia has inspired a backlash across the country.. My former home of St. Louis boasts, as one of its historical gems, the Old Courthouse. Countless important moments in American history took place in the 19th-century building. Admittedly, St. Louisans don't brag about its connection to one of the most notorious and degrading legal decisions in American history.

title: U.S. Will Pull Visas of Venezuelan Officials of Maduro Regime
summary: Diplomatic move comes after Washington and others recognized Guaidó as country's president. WASHINGTON-The U.S. will revoke visas held by government officials serving under authoritarian leader Nicolás Maduro, the top U.S. envoy for Venezuela, Elliott Abrams, said Thursday.

title: Is Self-Reliance a Mental Illness?
summary: Today's psychologists regard Emerson's values as obsolete and pathological.. Ralph Waldo Emerson's 1841 essay "Self-Reliance" is a statement of American values. "Whoso would be a man must be a nonconformist." "God will not have his work made manifest by cowards." "Society everywhere is in conspiracy against the manhood of every one of its members." "The sinew and heart of man seem to be drawn out, and we are become timorous, desponding whimperers. We are afraid of truth, afraid of fortune, afraid of death, and afraid of each other."

title: Eurozone Economic Forecasts Slashed
summary: The eurozone's waning fortunes reflect a drastic turn of events from just two years ago. BRUSSELS-Europe's economy faces a daunting combination of weaker demand for its exports from China and elsewhere, the prospect of a messy divorce with the U.K. and political problems closer to home, the European Union warned Thursday.

title: India Is Falling Behind China in an Asian Arms Race
summary: High defense-spending totals mask the weakness of its weapons systems, and the threat is growing.. When it comes to military spunk, no Indian politician shows it off like Narendra Modi. The prime minister sometimes dons camouflage to celebrate Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights, with troops on the borders with China and Pakistan.

title: Virginia's Confederacy of Dunces
summary: How can we continue looking down on Arkansas and Mississippi with this sort of stuff going on?. Midlothian, Va.

title: If It Innovates, Tax It, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Suggests
summary: Congress's young socialist neglects the ways the public benefits from federal research funding.. At a recent hearing on drug prices, Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez said that by funding federal research agencies such as the National Institutes of Health, "the public is acting as an early investor, putting tons of money in the development of drugs that then become privatized." The American people, she complained, receive "no return on the investment that they have made." The witness she was addressing, Harvard Medical School professor Aaron Kesselheim, confirmed the absence of "licensing deals that bring money back into the coffers of the NIH."

title: Notable & Quotable: Running
summary: 'A theft...suspect ran straight into a running club during his getaway and was promptly chased down by the fleet-footed group.'. Stephanie Farrreporting at Philly.com, Feb. 6:

title: Woody Allen Sues Amazon Studios, Claiming Breach of Contract
summary: Lawsuit says Amazon terminated distribution deal with director without cause. Filmmaker Woody Allen sued Amazon Studios, claiming breach of contract for refusing to distribute his most recent movie, "A Rainy Day in New York," and terminating a four-picture production and distribution deal without cause.

title: Bankruptcy Judge Says He Will Approve Lampert Purchase of Sears
summary: Judge says the Sears chairman and his hedge fund have a credible plan to keep 425 stores open. A bankruptcy judge said Thursday he would approve Edward Lampert's bid to purchase Sears Holdings Corp. , a decision that will keep the doors open at more than 400 stores and see 45,000 people keep their jobs.

title: Lawmakers Say Border Talks Are Making Progress
summary: Trump signals to negotiators he is eager to sign a bipartisan deal rather than declare a national emergency. WASHINGTON-Lawmakers said they were making progress Thursday in their talks over border barriers, while President Trump signaled to negotiators that he was eager to sign a bipartisan deal rather than declare a national emergency.

title: BB&T to Buy SunTrust in U.S.'s Biggest Postcrisis Bank Deal
summary: All-stock deal will combine two big regional lenders with long histories in the South. BB&T Corp. struck a deal to buy SunTrust Banks Inc. for $28.2 billion, combining two regional lending powerhouses to create the sixth-largest U.S. retail bank and end a decadelong drought in big bank mergers.

title: Vale Dam Auditor Told Police He Felt Pressured to Attest to Safety of Dam
summary: The auditor said the company knew of the risks days before the collapse. SÃO PAULO-A safety auditor who inspected a Vale SA mine-tailings dam that collapsed in January killing at least 150 people told police he felt pressured to attest to its stability, despite indications it was unsafe, because he feared losing business with the company, according to court documents seen by The Wall Street Journal.

title: Vimeo Is a Must-See Feature at IAC
summary: Video company Vimeo's results were broken out for the first time within parent IAC and its potential looks impressive. In the digital age, content is king.

title: Dollar Pares Gains on Concerns Over U.S.-China Spat
summary: Worries over global growth also weighed on the euro. The dollar pared its gains Thursday, as concerns over a trade conflict between the U.S. and China pushed investors into haven currencies.

title: Digital First to Attempt an Overhaul of Gannett Board
summary: USA Today publisher faces a proxy fight after rejecting Digital First's takeover bid. Digital First Media, the hedge-fund-backed newspaper chain whose takeover bid for Gannett Co. was rejected, has launched a proxy fight in an attempt to remake Gannett's board of directors.

title: Trump Administration to Present Economic Portion of Mideast Peace Plan
summary: White House aims to build support from Arab allies for plan to end Israeli-Palestinian conflict. WASHINGTON-A portion of the Trump administration's long-awaited Israeli-Palestinian peace plan will be presented to a number of allies in the coming weeks in the hope of drumming up the support needed to persuade both sides to come to the table and end the seven-decade conflict, a senior White House official said Thursday.

title: Apple to Reward Teen as It Patches FaceTime Bug
summary: The tech giant plans to make a gift toward Arizona teenager's education. Apple Inc. plugged a major flaw in its FaceTime video-chat software Thursday, and said it would pay a 14-year-old from Arizona for reporting the problem.

title: Aid Convoy Arrives at Tense Venezuelan Border
summary: Trucks bearing food spurned by President Maduro and summoned by his challenger Juan Guaidó are poised at Colombian frontier. CÚCUTA, Colombia-Cargo trucks escorted by Colombian police began arriving at this border crossing Thursday afternoon bearing humanitarian aid that opponents of Venezuela's authoritarian leader, Nicolás Maduro, say they plan to transport into Venezuela against his will.

title: Employees Are Accessing More and More Business Apps, Study Finds
summary: Nearly 10% of businesses now have more than 200 apps, Okta study says. The number of software apps deployed by large firms across all industries world-wide has increased 68% over the past four years, reaching an average of 129 apps per company by the end of 2018, according to an analysis by Okta Inc.

title: House Democrats Split on How Aggressively to Investigate Trump
summary: Liberal wing seeks to accelerate tax-returns probe; leadership seeks methodical approach. WASHINGTON-Divisions among Democrats over investigating President Trump's tax returns broke out into the open ahead of a high-profile hearing Thursday, reflecting a broader tension within the party over how aggressively to probe the administration.

title: Turkish Subsidiary Hid Iranian Activity from U.S. Parent, Treasury Says
summary: Kollmorgen Corp. extensive compliance efforts weren't enough to stop the Iran business, according to the Treasury. A settlement reached Thursday by a Virginia company over alleged efforts by a Turkey-based affiliate to evade U.S. sanctions on Iran demonstrates the difficulty of keeping far-flung units in line with corporate policy.

title: News Corp Swings to Quarterly Profit
summary: Company posts substantial gain in revenue, helped by consolidation of earnings from Australian TV assets. News Corp swung to a profit and posted a substantial gain in revenue in the December quarter, helped by the consolidation of earnings from its Australian television assets.

title: Congress Moves to Counter OPEC's Pursuit of Pact With Russia
summary: A group of U.S. senators unveiled a bill that would allow the Justice Department to sue members of OPEC for antitrust violations. WASHINGTON-A bipartisan group of U.S. senators rolled out a bill Thursday that would allow the Justice Department to sue members of OPEC for antitrust violations as the oil cartel looks to formalize closer ties with Russia.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended Feb. 2
summary: With data from NPD BookScan. NPD BookScan gathers point-of-sale book data from more than 16,000 locations across the U.S., representing about 85% of the nation's book sales. Print-book data providers include all major booksellers, web retailers and food stores. E-book data providers include all major e-book retailers. Free e-books and those selling for less than 99 cents are excluded from the ebook lists. The fiction and nonfiction combined lists include aggregated sales for all book formats (except audio books, bundles, boxed sets and foreign language editions) and feature a combination of adult, young adult and juvenile titles. The hardcover fiction and nonfiction lists also encompass a mix of adult, young adult and juvenile titles while the business list features only adult hardcover titles. Refer questions to Teresa.Vozzo@wsj.com.

title: Democrats Take a First Step Toward Obtaining Trump's Tax Returns
summary: Lawyers argued at House Ways and Means subcommittee hearing that Congress has authority to get the returns. WASHINGTON-House Democrats took the first formal steps toward getting President Trump's long-secret tax returns, opening a battle that could land in the courts.

title: Powell to Deliver Report to Senate Banking Committee This Month
summary: The Fed chief is to testify before the House Financial Services Committee the following day. WASHINGTON-Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell will deliver his seminannual monetary policy report to the Senate Banking Committee on Feb. 26, the committee said Thursday.

title: New York Spent $1.5 Million to Keep Statue of Liberty Open, $52,000 for Cuomo Inauguration
summary: Senior adviser to governor says official event was for all statewide elected officials; Republicans criticize use of public money to promote political agenda. New York state taxpayers spent $1.5 million to keep the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island open during the recent partial federal government shutdown, and more than $52,000 for Gov. Andrew Cuomo's inauguration ceremony on Ellis Island.

title: The Northam Mess and a Statute of Maturity
summary: The strict liability and immediate march to the gallows for some people's past indiscretions isn't the answer.. Your editorial "Ralph Northam's Racial Education" (Feb. 4) can educate the rest of America, too. Though I'm no fan of Gov. Northam, today's progressives remind me of the Soviet Union where one could be a good communist one day and be taken down the next by an enemy, opportunist or ideological Ringwraith. A careless word, an indiscretion, a suspicious friendship, no matter how old or how much regretted, and you were gone. Do we want the most shameful moment of a person's life to define them forever? Is this the "progressive" agenda America wants?

title: I'll Kick In for the Wall, if They Pay for Medicare for All
summary: Seems like a fair trade.. Letter writer Bruce Hauben (Feb. 2) suggests that those who voted for President Trump kick in about $90 each to pay for a border wall. While I didn't vote for President Trump, I would gladly kick in $90 for that wall. In exchange, maybe only those voting for a Democratic candidate should pay for Medicare for All, "free" college tuition and all the other assorted free things being offered by Democrats. Seems fair to me.

title: U.S. Stocks Slide on Trade Tensions, Global Growth Fears
summary: Investors are grappling with conflicting economic signals, curbing enthusiasm for risk-taking. The Dow Jones Industrial Average slumped more than 200 points Thursday, its steepest loss in two weeks, as trade tensions and bleak economic data from Europe renewed fears of a slowdown in global growth.

title: 'Never Look Away' Review: Towering Art as High Drama
summary: Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck's latest feature explores the power of art as exemplified by an artist who resembles painter Gerhard Richter.. When your debut feature wins an Oscar-and almost universal acclaim-the path ahead probably leads downhill. That was the case for the German filmmaker Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. His electrifying 2006 political thriller, "The Lives of Others," set in the former East Germany, explored state-sponsored surveillance, the beauty of empathy, and what it means to be human. His second film, "The Tourist," starred Angelina Jolie and Johnny Depp in a silly Hollywood confection about gangsters and mistaken identity; it left Mr. Donnersmarck's admirers wondering how he would climb back from such a steep descent. "Never Look Away," in German with English subtitles and entering national release this week, provides the answer: by taking on, with formidable if not total success, a mountainous subject-the power of art as exemplified by an artist who resembles the towering figure of Gerhard Richter, and as dramatized in a fateful family saga across three eras of German history.

title: Surdna Foundation Honors Founder's Wish
summary: Leaders of the Surdna Foundation and related Andrus philanthropies believe John E. Andrus would approve of how we have honored his legacy.. Long before people used DNA to learn about their families, my family recorded our history and passed it down. We are nearly 500 cousins strong, all direct or married descendants of John E. Andrus. As cousins, we are united by his legacy but don't all think alike. James Piereson and Naomi Schaefer Riley express concern about whether John Andrus would approve of today's mission of the Surdna Foundation ("A Battle Over a Capitalist's Legacy," op-ed, Jan. 31). Leaders of the Surdna Foundation and related Andrus philanthropies believe he would approve of how we have honored his legacy. He didn't impose restrictions on his very generous bequest, instead granting future generations of his family the scope to manage the strategic direction. Over a hundred family members have answered the call to serve across family philanthropies, honoring a tradition of service unparalleled in American philanthropy.

title: 'The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part': The Building Blocks of Animation's Future
summary: This sequel brings back the characters, charm and creativity that made the first film a hit, all while inflaming the imagination.. To begin at the end, I have this to report about a recent Hollywood screening of "The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part." As the end credits rolled-and rolled and rolled, as they must in order to recognize the vast number of people involved in making a big-budget animated feature-the only screen visible was the big one at the front of the theater. No one did what moviegoers do reflexively these days when a movie is almost over, light up their phones to see what they've been missing. Maybe it was because my audience skewed young, but kids have phones too. Partly it was because the filmmakers had taken the unprecedented step of creating end credits that are nearly as much fun as the adventure that precedes them. In any case, what a tribute to the film and what a concept-a hugely ambitious sequel, joyous and genuinely complex, that's charged with dramatic and musical energy to the very last frame.

title: 'Cold Pursuit' Review: Tepid Antics
summary: Liam Neeson stars as a revenge-seeking snowplow operator in this clumsy remake of a Norwegian film.. 'Cold Pursuit" finds Liam Neeson once again in avenger mode-it's a given that he's recapitulating the spirit of "Taken." A preface opens with an epigram from Oscar Wilde: "Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go." This comedy thriller means to cause happiness in audiences by showing so many stupid killings of stupid people that laughter is the only response. But it's not. Unhappiness is permitted too. The stupidity lacks smarts in the script department, and the joke, such as it is, wears thin, then turns sour.

title: Baseball Legend Frank Robinson Dies at Age 83
summary: Robinson was the first black manager in the majors and the only man to win MVP honors in both the American and National Leagues. Frank Robinson is, by any conceivable measure, on the short list of the best players in baseball history. He is the only man ever to earn Most Valuable Player honors in both leagues. He won the triple crown in 1966. He retired with 586 home runs, which at the time trailed only Hank Aaron, Babe Ruth and Willie Mays. He was inducted into the Hall of Fame with nearly 90% of the vote the first time he appeared on the ballot.

title: Three-Month Libor Falls the Most Since 2009
summary: The cost for banks to borrow U.S. dollars for three months posted its biggest one-day decline in a decade Thursday. The cost for banks to borrow U.S. dollars for three months posted its biggest one-day decline in a decade Thursday, reflecting the easing of financial conditions after the Federal Reserve's recent shift to a cautious approach toward raising interest rates.

title: South African Leader Backs Corruption Prosecutions
summary: President calls corruption charges 'deeply disturbing' even as he tries to mobilize bloc for election. CAPE TOWN, South Africa-South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Thursday pledged to support criminal prosecutions of senior members of his own party facing what he called "deeply disturbing" allegations of corruption.

title: Tepid Earnings Forecasts Are Next Test for Bull Market
summary: Companies are on track to report a 1.4% decline in profits in the first quarter from a year earlier. The yearslong expansion in U.S. corporate profits may be coming to an end sooner than investors expected, a warning sign for the nearly decadelong bull market.

title: 'White Dragon' Review: A Wife's Secret Life
summary: A British professor mourning the loss of his beloved spouse travels to Hong Kong and searches for her killers.. The two stars of "White Dragon" (Friday, Amazon Prime) don't have much in common. They are, respectively, the city of Hong Kong and John Simm ("Dr. Who," "Life on Mars"), and together they ensure that this eight-episode series filled with heavy-breathing conspirators, multiplying menaces and other reliable indicators of ordinariness instead builds to a sizzling life. Mr. Simm, expert at portraying characters buffeted by a hard world, plays Jonah Mulray, a man desperate to find the killers responsible for his wife's murder. Prior to the tragedy he's led a tranquil life as a professor at a London university where he first shows up delivering genial academic witticisms in a lecture hall full of students. All that ends when class is interrupted by a police officer bringing word that his adored wife, Megan Harris (Dervla Kirwan), who had been off on one of her strangely frequent business trips to Hong Kong, had died there in a violent auto accident.

title: 'Wild Way of the Vikings' Review: Conquerors or Conservationists?
summary: The best part of this documentary about the Vikings' and the natural world are the glorious images of wildlife.. 'Wild Way of the Vikings" (Wednesday, 8 p.m., PBS) undertakes a rehabilitation of sorts in its portrait of this storied culture of hunters, warriors and explorers, described in terms throbbing with unstinting reverence as benefactors of nature. The accolades showered on these hunters-especially for using every part of the living creatures they killed-are such that one expects to hear at any moment that the Vikings should be models for today's nature conservationists.

title: Elizabeth Warren's 'American Indian' Claim
summary: She presented herself as a minority except when applying to the Ivy League?. For what reason, other than to gain advantage, does a white lawyer without any recognized tribal affiliation describe her race as "American Indian" on a government document? The latest revelation about Sen. Elizabeth Warren's longtime effort to present herself as Native American highlights just one of several holes remaining in her story. Democrats choosing from an abundance of leftist candidates for their party's 2020 presidential nomination may wonder how many more such revelations they can stand.

title: Suffolk County to Use Post-Sandy Funding on Sewer Project
summary: Nearly 6,400 homes will be connected to public sewers as part of $360 million project. Suffolk County has struggled to fix its sewer problem for decades, and officials there finally have the money and voter approval to start installing sewers in two low-lying areas.

title: Watchdog Seeks Chapter 11 Examiner for IPS Worldwide
summary: Resume Subscription. A government watchdog has asked a bankruptcy judge to sign off on the appointment of an examiner to investigate freight-payment company IPS Worldwide LLC.

title: BB&T-SunTrust Tie-Up Brings Tech Budgets Into Focus
summary: Deal shows how banks are spending more on technology to attract new customers. Behind one of the biggest bank deals in a decade is a recognition that BB&T Corp. and SunTrust Banks Inc., both dominant banks in the South, would be more competitive with a bigger tech budget.

title: Russian Gold Find Brightens Ruble's Future
summary: Sukhoi Log, widely seen as one of the world's largest untapped gold deposits, could give Moscow a bulletproof currency backstop. SUKHOI LOG, Russia-Beneath this plot of land in southeastern Siberia lie vast stores of gold, according to Russia's biggest gold producer, Polyus PJSC , and tapping them could provide the Russian central bank with a huge and nearly sanction-proof backstop for its currency.

title: Kellogg's Brand Investments Temper Profit
summary: Natural-foods company Hain Celestial also struggles with shrinking margins. Kellogg Co. said investments in new snacks and cereals are denting profits but fueling a turnaround in sales.

title: Postmates Files for IPO
summary: The size and price range for the delivery company's initial public offering have yet to be determined. Delivery company Postmates Inc. has filed confidentially for an initial public offering, the company said Thursday.

title: A Crypto-Mystery: Is $136 Million Stuck or Missing?
summary: Customer holdings are trapped in an electronic vault after founder's reported death, but researchers aren't so sure.

title: U.S. Government Bonds Rally as Europe's Economy Weakens
summary: Yields fall as investors seek safety amid increasing concerns about Europe's economy. U.S. government bonds strengthened Thursday as investors favored safer assets amid growing concerns about Europe's economy.

title: Zurich Annual Net Profit Rises
summary: Insurer's life and property-and-casualty insurance units drove stronger performance.. ZURICH-- Zurich Insurance Group AG said Thursday that its net profit rose in 2018, driven by strong performance in its life and property-and-casualty units.

title: Why the Ford F-150 SuperCrew Limited Sparks Joy
summary: When tidying up this spring Marie Kondo-style, you'll need a truck to haul away unwanted items. With space for a hefty payload, this power-beast does the trick, says Dan Neil. THE MARIE KONDO organizing mania has struck our household, from the attic to the basement. I have to say, the one thing missing from Ms. Kondo's counsel is the usefulness of a big ol' pickup truck, one capable of hauling unwanted items to flea markets, donation centers and landfills. That's right. The road to inner peace runs through Dearborn, Mich.

title: Pressure Grows on U.S., China to Forge Trade Deal
summary: From Stephen Schwarzman to Hank Paulson, top business figures are worried about the consequences of failure in talks before a March deadline. WASHINGTON-As a deadline approaches for a high-stakes trade deal between the U.S. and China, some top American business figures who fear the economic and market consequences of a failure are pushing both sides to compromise.

title: Glass Block in Décor: Cheesy or Charming?
summary: For some, it triggers memories of the kitschy 1980s. Others find it hypnotizing and timeless. Debating the merits of the translucent walls' return to vogue. AS A KID, I was beguiled by the prisms you could buy in science stores. They made a toy of the light. Today, I get the same nerdy kick from glass block, the way it garbles objects on the other side of it and dapples incoming light.

title: Venezuela's Path from Riches to Ruin
summary: Resume Subscription. The discovery of oil in the early 20th century transformed Venezuela from an economic backwater into one of the richest nations in South America. Today, the country is grappling with a political crisis and an economic meltdown, which has led to shortages of food and medicine and prompted hundreds of thousands to flee.

title: Is the Gown Dead? An Awards-Season Debate
summary: Floor-length dresses give a lot of women the heebie jeebies, prompting fears of looking matronly. That's changing, if innovative brands like Valentino and the Row have anything to do with it. WITH THE Super Bowl safely behind us, we armchair commentators can turn to the real winter sport-the perilous procession of gowns down the red carpet. Come awards seasons, elite coaches armed with double-sided tape prep competitors like Lady Gaga and Emma Stone to face the cameras and the harping critics. The rest of us can lazily pass judgment, but would we dare to wear such gowns ourselves? Would we even want to in an era when the legendary stylist Grace Coddington dressed down in pajamas for the Met Gala?

title: Oil Prices Drop on Worries Over Global Demand
summary: Crude prices further tumbled amid uncertainty over the fate of the U.S.-China trade talks. • Oil prices fell to their lowest level in more than a week on Thursday due to renewed worries of a global economic slowdown that could pinch demand for oil.

title: Tap. Tap. Scraaatch. Introducing the Michelob Super Bowl Ad That's a Meditation Technique.
summary: Phenomenon known as 'ASMR' channels tactile sounds such as crinkling paper and whispers into online hits. The nation was ready to fall asleep.

title: Twitter's Push for Healthier Discourse Lifts Revenue, Hurts User Growth
summary: Social-media company posts record quarterly revenue, but shares fall after decline in monthly users. Twitter Inc. reported record quarterly revenue and its first full year of profitability Thursday, signs the company's efforts to promote healthy discourse on the platform appear to be paying off.

title: Danske Bank Faces French Money-Laundering Probe
summary: The largest Danish lender is also under investigation in the U.S., U.K., Denmark and Estonia. Danske Bank A/S said Thursday it was placed under formal investigation by a judge in France over suspicions of money laundering related to terminated business at its Estonian branch.

title: Former New York Times Executive Editor Faces Plagiarism Allegations
summary: Jill Abramson, whose book 'Merchants of Truth' scrutinizes the media business, is now facing questions of her own by critics in the media industry. Former New York Times Executive Editor Jill Abramson is facing accusations that she plagiarized passages of her new book about the media industry.

title: Saudi-Commissioned Report Contests U.S. Finding About Khashoggi Killing
summary: Report says message exchange CIA cited between crown prince and aide didn't mention journalist. WASHINGTON-The Saudi government is contesting a prominent element of a CIA assessment that concluded Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman likely ordered the killing of Jamal Khashoggi, as Riyadh seeks to mend its reputation after the death of the journalist and political activist.

title: 'Macbeth' Review: Unobtrusively Modern
summary: In Rhode Island, a Shakespeare tragedy gets an update while staying true to the original..

title: Book Shopping on Amazon? Don't Be Duped Into Buying a Summary
summary: E-commerce giant pulls shortened versions of popular reads like Marie Kondo's 'Tidying Up' and Timothy Ferriss's 'The 4-Hour Body' after Journal inquiry. Summaries of popular books have long been a staple in the publishing business. Now they are often hard to tell apart from the real thing.

title: New York's Grand Hyatt Hotel to Be Torn Down
summary: Developers plan to replace the hotel with a mixed-use tower totaling 2 million square feet. A development group has agreed to buy and tear down the Grand Hyatt New York, the glass-sheathed hotel by Grand Central Terminal that was Donald Trump's first major Manhattan development, and replace it with a mixed-use project.

title: Stay for Leftovers at Grubhub
summary: Online food-delivery leader faces increasing competition, but retains a strong position. Grubhub investors may be eating their feelings.

title: France Recalls Ambassador to Italy to Protest Yellow Vest Meeting
summary: Move follows Italy's deputy prime minister meeting near Paris with activists from French antigovernment group. PARIS-France recalled its ambassador to Italy on Thursday in protest after Italy's deputy prime minister met near Paris this week with prominent members of the antigovernment yellow-vest movement, opening a rift between the longtime European allies without precedent in the postwar era.

title: Stocks to Watch: Chipotle, Sonos, GE, Take-Two Interactive Software
summary: Resume Subscription. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Thursday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Senate Committee Votes to Advance Trump's Attorney General Pick
summary: Republican-controlled Senate likely to confirm Barr as Democrats raise concerns over potential handling of Mueller probe. WASHINGTON-A divided Senate Judiciary Committee on Thursday advanced President Trump's nomination of William Barr for attorney general over Democrats' concerns about how he would manage the special counsel's Russia investigation and whether he would make its findings public.

title: Judge Orders Release of Records Related to Cohen Raid
summary: President Trump's former lawyer has said he arranged hush payments at Mr. Trump's direction. Portions of law-enforcement records related to a federal probe of President Trump's former lawyer will be made public, a federal judge said Thursday, in a ruling that will grant visibility into the investigation that led Michael Cohen to implicate Mr. Trump in federal crimes.

title: Rescue Teams Race to Find Victims of Istanbul Building Collapse
summary: Five-year-old girl is recovered after being trapped under layers of concrete from seven-story apartment structure that had been illegally elevated. ISTANBUL-Rescue teams raced to extract more people from the rubble of a seven-story apartment building on the Asian side of the Turkish megalopolis, a day after the illegally elevated structure collapsed, killing at least 10 people.

title: BB&T-SunTrust Deal May Not Give Other Banks Urge to Merge
summary: Many medium-size U.S. banks could benefit from greater scale, but the merger of BB&T and SunTrust doesn't necessarily herald a wave of deals. BB&T 's deal to buy SunTrust Banks was portrayed by some as the starting gun in the consolidation of regional U.S. banks.

title: Aramco Courts U.S. Investors Ahead of Debt Sale
summary: Saudi oil company looks to raise debt to purchase part of the country's petrochemicals firm. DUBAI-Saudi Aramco executives traveled to the U.S. this week to court investors ahead of a potential $10 billion bond sale, reviving an idea to partially fund the acquisition of Saudi Arabia's national petrochemical firm, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Crank Up the Flavor: Leftover Rotisserie Chicken Recipes
summary: Take a fresh look at yesterday's bird. These easy Vietnamese recipes use every delicious bit. IN THE EARLY 1970s, my mom decided to raise chickens. Our three-story home in Saigon lacked a yard for them to scratch around in, but she craved the fresh eggs and tasty homegrown birds of her youth. So she bought a bunch of chicks, and we five kids delighted in having the fuzzy cuties around. Then one of our housekeepers, a cheerful, large woman, stepped on a chick and killed it. My siblings and I freaked out, and Mom realized her city kids weren't ready for animal husbandry.

title: The Latest Ski Trend Takes the Sport Back to its Origins

Zealots laud the merits of hard-fought climbs, relishing a few memorable runs a day rather than fighting lift lines and rising resort costs. But now more skiers want it all-one high-performance setup to go up and downhill in any snowy terrain-and companies are producing versatile new gear like the collection shown here. title: The Enduring Appeal of Märta Måås-Fjetterström's Modernist Swedish Rugs
summary: At 100, the Swedish rug firm still produces covetable designs. A Swedish artist working in the early years of the last century, quietly radical in her choices of clear, bright colors and abstract imagery. Pioneering painter Hilma af Klint, the subject of a blockbuster show currently on view at New York's Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, isn't the only one who fits this description. Meet her contemporary Märta Måås-Fjetterström, an inspired designer of carpets and tapestries. Born in 1873, Måås-Fjetterström trained in illustration and art instruction at Stockholm's School of Industrial Arts. In 1919, she set up a workshop in the town of Båstad, on Sweden's southwest coast, to produce her weavings, which drew on Eastern and Western folkloric traditions and the landscape of the surrounding county of Skåne. Her refined palette and gift for abstraction helped her ride a wave of interest in Swedish modernism, and commissions from the U.N., the Nobel Prize Committee and the Swedish royal family led to a 1937 exhibition at New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art. Though her work is now little known outside Sweden, a circle of collectors is widening by the year.

summary: Scandal after scandal and mistake after mistake reveal their lack of preparedness.. Tuesday was a miserable night for congressional Democrats. Most looked as if they would rather be anywhere other than in the House chamber, listening to the State of the Union.

title: The Longest Day for Trump's Adversaries
summary: His State of the Union address dramatically advanced his case for re-election in 2020.. Donald Trump's State of the Union address was a masterpiece-for his purposes. Two chaotic years into his term, Mr. Trump appeared presidential for seemingly the first time and dramatically advanced his chances for re-election in 2020.

title: 'Empty Planet' Review: A Drop in Numbers
summary: Governments stoke fears about overpopulation, but the reality is that fertility rates are falling faster than most experts can readily explain.. Is a dangerous population explosion imminent? For decades we've been told so by scientific elites, starting with the Club of Rome reports in the 1970s. But in their compelling book "Empty Planet: The Shock of Global Population Decline," Canadian social scientist Darrell Bricker and journalist John Ibbitson lay out the opposite case: "The great defining event of the twenty-first century," they say, "will occur in three decades, give or take, when the global population starts to decline. Once that decline begins, it will never end."

title: Justice Department Revisits Its Probe of Florida Financier
summary: Campaign donor Jeffrey Epstein allegedly had a history of sexual misconduct with underage girls but pleaded guilty to a lesser charge. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department is probing its handling of a decade-old investigation into a politically connected campaign donor and financier who pleaded guilty in Florida to a single count of soliciting prostitution.
